name: Yellowstone Prong
description:
Creek stomp through Lower falls, rappel second falls (optional single pitch), continue down to Yellowstone falls (mandatory rappel 2 pitches), continue to skinny dip falls and exit to trail.).

Approach

Graveyard fields overlook parking lot

Descent

Second falls around 75 ft rappel (optional) river right off of boulder (watch for snakes) ending at the base of the pool.

Creekstomp down to Yellowstone Falls, 2 pitches both around 150 ft. Both Anchors were off of trees. 1st pitch started river right and rappelled down the middle of the waterfall ending up river left. 2nd Rappel stayed river left ended up at the base of the falls, keeping out of the water.

The rest of the trip is boulder hopping until you reach skinny dip falls and exit to trailhead.

Exit

Can set shuttle from graveyard fields (put in) and bridges camp gap (take out). I would recommend this as it will save you time and energy.

Also possible to take the MTS trail back up to graveyard fields parking.

Red tape

Beta sites

Bogley Outdoor Community - Tombstone Blues First Descent, Pisgah National Forest

Trip reports and media

Tombstone Blues First Descent, Pisgah National Forest - Bogley Outdoor Community Fridays on the Fly: Tenkanyoneering - Blue Ridge Outdoors
